chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Lloyd Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 2/6/2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of probation or civil judgment.
Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No drugs or alcohol.  
No contact with victim Jasmine W. without prior Court approval.  May have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.  
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfuly compete any other counseling and/or tratment deemd appropriate.
Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Lloyd Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Email from DOC agent, Jodi Smith, that the defendant reported to probation orientation on 11-3-2014.  Agent left paperwork for him to report on 11-25-2014 for intake appointment.  Defendant failed to report as directed.  An apprehension request was submitted and his current whereabouts are unknown.  MCORP agent attempted a home vsit on 12-11-2014, and they were informed by his mother that she had not seen him ina few days.  The agent also spoke with his sister on 1-13-2015, and stated she had not seen him in a while.  At this time the Department is not asking for condition time be imposed.  This agent will contact the court if there is a need for a review after defendant is in custody.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 2-6-2015 at 1:30 pm, is cancelled at request of agent.   mld

Defendant Maurice Lloyd in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Maurice Lloyd in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Jasmine W. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CM1634), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 20 MONTHS.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 35 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Jasmine W., 
   without prior court approval.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 2-6-2015 AT 1:30 PM.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Maurice Lloyd in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of trial.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the repeater modifier on COUNT #2.  

AS TO COUNT #2 (without the repeater modifier): Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-27-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Victim is present.  There are no pretrial motions.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.   mld

Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins in court, defendant Maurice Lloyd not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Based on the unavailability of witness, the Court heard and granted the Motion of the State to Adjourn the Jury Trial.  Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned to Branch 4 on 10-20-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Maurice Lloyd not in court, in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense received discovery.    Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 4.    Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Maurice Lloyd not in court, in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defendant is currently revoked.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-1-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Maurice Lloyd Jr. appeared in court with attorney Alexis Liggins appeared in Court.  Defendant Maurice Lloyd in custody.  
 Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
COUNT #2 was amended from a felony to a misdemeanor, which now makes this case a misdemeanor.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on both counts on behalf of defendant.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld

received and filed.   
-
COUNT #2 INTENTIONALLY CONTACT VICTIM, WITNESS OR CO-ACTOR AFTER COURT ORDER FOR A MISDEMEANOR CONVICTION, REPEATER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.39(2) and 939.62(1)(a).   mld
with Justice Point Supervision continued.   mld

Attorney Alexis Liggins appeared in Court.  Defendant Maurice Lloyd NOT in court, in custody.  Evans Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant is currently on a VOP hold.  Case was incorrectly charged, per the State.  ADA Heitman advised the Court and defense counsel, that the case would remain a felony once case is properly charged.  Upon the agreement of all parties, the Preliminary Hearing is adjourned to 5-21-2014 at 1:30 pm.      

 Court heard and granted the motion of the State to reduce bail.   mld

ADDRESS INFO for Maurice Lloyd Jr
Current: 3853  N 3rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 04-26-2014)
Prior: 115 West Hadley Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jasmine W.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for enhanced SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Maurice Lloyd in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Maurice Lloyd in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
